channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: CSTA: CNN-based Spatiotemporal Attention for Video Summarization
item.description: Video summarization aims to generate a concise representation of a video, capturing its essential content and key moments while reducing its overall length.

item.title: FAME-MT Dataset: Formality Awareness Made Easy for Machine Translation Purposes
item.description: People use language for various purposes.

item.title: Versatile Teacher: A Class-aware Teacher-student Framework for Cross-domain Adaptation
item.description: Addressing the challenge of domain shift between datasets is vital in maintaining model performance.

item.title: Fennec: Fine-grained Language Model Evaluation and Correction Extended through Branching and Bridging
item.description: The rapid advancement of large language models has given rise to a plethora of applications across a myriad of real-world tasks, mainly centered on aligning with human intent.

item.title: TinyLLaVA Factory: A Modularized Codebase for Small-scale Large Multimodal Models
item.description: We present TinyLLaVA Factory, an open-source modular codebase for small-scale large multimodal models (LMMs) with a focus on simplicity of code implementations, extensibility of new features, and reproducibility of training results.

item.title: MathBench: Evaluating the Theory and Application Proficiency of LLMs with a Hierarchical Mathematics Benchmark
item.description: MathBench spans a wide range of mathematical disciplines, offering a detailed evaluation of both theoretical understanding and practical problem-solving skills.

item.title: Feasibility Consistent Representation Learning for Safe Reinforcement Learning
item.description: A key obstacle in this endeavor is the estimation of safety constraints, which is typically more difficult than estimating a reward metric due to the sparse nature of the constraint signals.

item.title: Out-of-Distribution Detection with a Single Unconditional Diffusion Model
item.description: To that end, we introduce our method, Diffusion Paths, (DiffPath) in this work.

item.title: Modeling User Fatigue for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: In this paper, we propose to model user Fatigue in interest learning for sequential Recommendations (FRec).

item.title: DATR: Unsupervised Domain Adaptive Detection Transformer with Dataset-Level Adaptation and Prototypical Alignment
item.description: Firstly, we propose the Class-wise Prototypes Alignment (CPA) module, which effectively aligns cross-domain features in a class-aware manner by bridging the gap between object detection task and domain adaptation task.

item.title: Position-Guided Prompt Learning for Anomaly Detection in Chest X-Rays
item.description: Anomaly detection in chest X-rays is a critical task.

item.title: Erasing the Bias: Fine-Tuning Foundation Models for Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: Semi-supervised learning (SSL) has witnessed remarkable progress, resulting in the emergence of numerous method variations.

item.title: SEMv3: A Fast and Robust Approach to Table Separation Line Detection
item.description: The `"split-and-merge" paradigm is a pivotal approach to parse table structure, where the table separation line detection is crucial.

item.title: Adversarially Diversified Rehearsal Memory (ADRM): Mitigating Memory Overfitting Challenge in Continual Learning
item.description: Finally, our detailed analysis of features and visualization demonstrates that ADRM mitigates feature drifts in CL memory samples, significantly reducing catastrophic forgetting and resulting in a more resilient CL model.

item.title: PATE: Proximity-Aware Time series anomaly Evaluation
item.description: We introduce Proximity-Aware Time series anomaly Evaluation (PATE), a novel evaluation metric that incorporates the temporal relationship between prediction and anomaly intervals.

item.title: Learning Spatial Similarity Distribution for Few-shot Object Counting
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a network learning Spatial Similarity Distribution (SSD) for few-shot object counting, which preserves the spatial structure of exemplar features and calculates a 4D similarity pyramid point-to-point between the query features and exemplar features, capturing the complete distribution information for each point in the 4D similarity space.

item.title: CaseGNN++: Graph Contrastive Learning for Legal Case Retrieval with Graph Augmentation
item.description: Specifically, an edge feature-based graph attention layer (EUGAT) is proposed to comprehensively update node and edge features during graph modelling, resulting in a full utilisation of structural information of legal cases.

item.title: Evaluating and Modeling Social Intelligence: A Comparative Study of Human and AI Capabilities
item.description: Facing the current debate on whether Large Language Models (LLMs) attain near-human intelligence levels (Mitchell & Krakauer, 2023; Bubeck et al., 2023; Kosinski, 2023; Shiffrin & Mitchell, 2023; Ullman, 2023), the current study introduces a benchmark for evaluating social intelligence, one of the most distinctive aspects of human cognition.

item.title: Multiple-Choice Questions are Efficient and Robust LLM Evaluators
item.description: We present GSM-MC and MATH-MC, two multiple-choice (MC) datasets constructed by collecting answers and incorrect predictions on GSM8K and MATH from over 50 open-source models.

item.title: Enhancing Explainable AI: A Hybrid Approach Combining GradCAM and LRP for CNN Interpretability
item.description: We present a new technique that explains the output of a CNN-based model using a combination of GradCAM and LRP methods.

item.title: Configurable Mirror Descent: Towards a Unification of Decision Making
item.description: Decision-making problems, categorized as single-agent, e. g., Atari, cooperative multi-agent, e. g., Hanabi, competitive multi-agent, e. g., Hold'em poker, and mixed cooperative and competitive, e. g., football, are ubiquitous in the real world.

item.title: Unveiling and Manipulating Prompt Influence in Large Language Models
item.description: Prompts play a crucial role in guiding the responses of Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: CLAMBER: A Benchmark of Identifying and Clarifying Ambiguous Information Needs in Large Language Models
item.description: To this end, we introduce CLAMBER, a benchmark for evaluating LLMs using a well-organized taxonomy.

item.title: MM-Retinal: Knowledge-Enhanced Foundational Pretraining with Fundus Image-Text Expertise
item.description: Current fundus image analysis models are predominantly built for specific tasks relying on individual datasets.

item.title: AutoSoccerPose: Automated 3D posture Analysis of Soccer Shot Movements
item.description: The dataset, code, and models are available at: https://github. com/calvinyeungck/3D-Shot-Posture-Dataset.

item.title: EPPS: Advanced Polyp Segmentation via Edge Information Injection and Selective Feature Decoupling
item.description: Furthermore, we introduce a component called Selective Feature Decoupler (SFD) to suppress the influence of noise and extraneous features on the model.

item.title: Foundation Model for Chemical Process Modeling: Meta-Learning with Physics-Informed Adaptation
item.description: In this work, we introduce a novel application of foundation models in the domain of nonlinear chemical process modeling.

item.title: Data Contamination Calibration for Black-box LLMs
item.description: The rapid advancements of Large Language Models (LLMs) tightly associate with the expansion of the training data size.

item.title: PT43D: A Probabilistic Transformer for Generating 3D Shapes from Single Highly-Ambiguous RGB Images
item.description: Experiments demonstrate that our model outperforms state of the art in both scenarios

item.title: Modeling citation worthiness by using attention-based bidirectional long short-term memory networks and interpretable models
item.description: This opens the door for our model to check documents during pre-submission and pre-archival procedures.

item.title: PULL: PU-Learning-based Accurate Link Prediction
item.description: Given an edge-incomplete graph, how can we accurately find the missing links?

item.title: Building Temporal Kernels with Orthogonal Polynomials
item.description: We introduce a class of models named PLEIADES (PoLynomial Expansion In Adaptive Distributed Event-based Systems), which contains temporal convolution kernels generated from orthogonal polynomial basis functions.

item.title: Efficient Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning by Planning
item.description: Extensive experiments on the SMAC benchmark demonstrate that MAZero outperforms model-free approaches in terms of sample efficiency and provides comparable or better performance than existing model-based methods in terms of both sample and computational efficiency.

item.title: OpenRLHF: An Easy-to-use, Scalable and High-performance RLHF Framework
item.description: However, unlike pretraining or fine-tuning a single model, scaling reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF) for training large language models poses coordination challenges across four models.

item.title: Highway Graph to Accelerate Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We focus on improving the training efficiency of RL algorithms by improving the efficiency of the value learning process.

item.title: Token-wise Influential Training Data Retrieval for Large Language Models
item.description: Given a Large Language Model (LLM) generation, how can we identify which training data led to this generation?

item.title: Uni-Mol Docking V2: Towards Realistic and Accurate Binding Pose Prediction
item.description: In recent years, machine learning (ML) methods have emerged as promising alternatives for molecular docking, offering the potential for high accuracy without incurring prohibitive computational costs.

item.title: A Novel Cartography-Based Curriculum Learning Method Applied on RoNLI: The First Romanian Natural Language Inference Corpus
item.description: Natural language inference (NLI), the task of recognizing the entailment relationship in sentence pairs, is an actively studied topic serving as a proxy for natural language understanding.

item.title: The First Swahili Language Scene Text Detection and Recognition Dataset
item.description: We propose a comprehensive dataset of Swahili scene text images and evaluate the dataset on different scene text detection and recognition models.

item.title: Transcriptomics-guided Slide Representation Learning in Computational Pathology
item.description: Across three independent test datasets consisting of 1, 265 breast WSIs, 1, 946 lung WSIs, and 4, 584 liver WSIs, Tangle shows significantly better few-shot performance compared to supervised and SSL baselines.

item.title: On Robust Reinforcement Learning with Lipschitz-Bounded Policy Networks
item.description: This paper presents a study of robust policy networks in deep reinforcement learning.

item.title: Large Language Models are Biased Reinforcement Learners
item.description: Given their potential use as (autonomous) decision-making agents, it is important to understand how these models perform such reinforcement learning (RL) tasks and the extent to which they are susceptible to biases.

item.title: Advancing 6-DoF Instrument Pose Estimation in Variable X-Ray Imaging Geometries
item.description: We propose a general-purpose approach of data acquisition for 6-DoF pose estimation tasks in X-ray systems, a novel and general purpose YOLOv5-6D pose architecture for accurate and fast object pose estimation and a complete method for surgical screw pose estimation under acquisition geometry consideration from a monocular cone-beam X-ray image.

item.title: NetMamba: Efficient Network Traffic Classification via Pre-training Unidirectional Mamba
item.description: Firstly, they struggle with model inefficiency due to the quadratic complexity of the widely used Transformer architecture.

item.title: Movie Revenue Prediction using Machine Learning Models
item.description: In the contemporary film industry, accurately predicting a movie's earnings is paramount for maximizing profitability.

item.title: Automated Coastline Extraction Using Edge Detection Algorithms
item.description: We analyse the effectiveness of edge detection algorithms for the purpose of automatically extracting coastlines from satellite images.

item.title: Reproducibility Study of CDUL: CLIP-Driven Unsupervised Learning for Multi-Label Image Classification
item.description: (3) We try to verify the effectiveness of the gradient-alignment training method specified in the original paper, which is used to update the network parameters and pseudo labels.

item.title: SLAB: Efficient Transformers with Simplified Linear Attention and Progressive Re-parameterized Batch Normalization
item.description: However, replacing LayerNorm with more efficient BatchNorm in transformer often leads to inferior performance and collapse in training.

item.title: MHPP: Exploring the Capabilities and Limitations of Language Models Beyond Basic Code Generation
item.description: Our study analyzed two common benchmarks, HumanEval and MBPP, and found that these might not thoroughly evaluate LLMs' code generation capacities due to limitations in quality, difficulty, and granularity.

item.title: Emphasizing Crucial Features for Efficient Image Restoration
item.description: SFAM consists of two modules: the spatial domain attention module (SDAM) and the frequency domain attention module (FDAM).
